###1.2
1.2(a)
```{r}
s = c(rep(0,100), 10*exp(-(1:100)/20)*cos(2*pi*101:200/4))
x = ts(s + rnorm(200, 0, 1))
plot(x)
```

1.2(b)
```{r}
s = c(rep(0,100), 10*exp(-(1:100)/200)*cos(2*pi*101:200/4))
x = ts(s + rnorm(200, 0, 1))
plot(x)
```

1.2(c)
1.2(a) resembles the explosion while 1.2(b) resembles the eathquake.

(a)
```{r}
s = c(rep(0,100), exp(-(1:100)/20))
x = ts(s + rnorm(200, 0, 1))
plot(x)
```

(b)
```{r}
s = c(rep(0,100), exp(-(1:100)/200))
x = ts(s + rnorm(200, 0, 1))
plot(x)
```

1.3(a)
```{r}
w = rnorm(100,0,1) 
x = filter(w, filter=c(0,-.9), method="recursive")
plot.ts(x, main="autoregression")
```

```{r}
v = filter(x, rep(1/4, 4), sides = 1)
plot.ts(v, main="autoregression")
```

1.3(b)
```{r}
w = 1:100 
x = filter(w, filter=cos(2*pi*w/4), method="recursive")
plot.ts(x, main="autoregression")
```


```{r}
v = filter(x, rep(1/4, 4), sides = 1)
plot.ts(v, main="autoregression")
```

1.3(c)
```{r}
w = rnorm(100,0,1) 
x = filter(w, filter=cos(2*pi*1:100/4)+ w, method="recursive")
plot.ts(x, main="autoregression")
```

```{r}
v = filter(x, rep(1/4, 4), sides = 1)
plot.ts(v, main="autoregression")
```
